attributes.action: Remove LIBERATA from the governments contractors list (EMA processing)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
About 150,000 teenagers in England are believed to be caught in a backlog for the Educational Maintenance Allowances of up to £30 a week. 
Liberata is an outsourcing company, with a majority stake owned by a private equity company with offices in the United States. Liberata has a six-year contract worth £80m to deliver EMAs and other projects for the The Learning and Skills Council.
The phone helpline system has not performed adequately and on occasions has crashed completely. Plans for an online system had already been postponed and the contractor is processing EMA applications semi-manually.
